intro: Aciotis alata, commonly known as the hairy aciotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy and serrated, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive white or pale blue ray floret. Aciotis alata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
